intro: Dianthus armeria f. alba, commonly known as the white sweet William, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are borne on upright stems and are often used in floral arrangements due to their delicate appearance. Dianthus armeria f. alba is relatively easy to cultivate and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
